fr.sorbonne_u.cps.map.withplugin.components

Class MapComponent<K extends java.io.Serializable,V extends java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.map.withplugin.components.MapComponent<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI

    public class MapComponent<K extends java.io.Serializable,V extends java.io.Serializable>
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
    The class MapComponent implements a hash map component that offers map services through a plug-in that manages the offering of the component interface MapI.

    Description

    Instead of including all the required code to implement the hash map component connection, this code is factored into the MapPlugin to be reusable and this component has only to install an instance of this plug-in.

    Note that this aims at showing how to use plug-ins in BCM components. However, this example is a little overshoot as reusing the code implementing a hash map is less useful that reusing the code to call the hash map (see MapClientPlugin).

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2019-03-21

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
